info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 24 at 5:51AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Patchy Dense Fog this Morning... Patchy fog was developing, or expected to develop, in the valleys of Southwest and Central Montana this morning. This fog will persist through approximately 10 AM MST to Noon MST and lead to reductions in visibility to as low as one to three miles across most locations; however, localized reductions to one-quarter of a mile are possible. Travelers should be prepared for changing conditions over short distances. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. If driving through fog, use your low beam headlights. Additionally, with temperatures below freezing across the valleys some surfaces may become slippery, especially bridges and overpasses.
